message.content:
cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.PL, cs.CV, cs.SE 

The paper discusses the use of the SYCL programming model for writing highly parameterized kernels for matrix multiplies and convolutions, which are commonly used in computer vision and machine learning applications (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the optimization of these kernels for different hardware architectures, which falls under the category of performance tuning and optimization (cs.AR). The use of C++ templates in the SYCL programming model is also mentioned, which is a topic related to programming languages and compilers (cs.PL). The paper also discusses the challenges of portability across different hardware platforms, which is a topic related to software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the use of heterogeneous systems, which is a topic related to distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
